display

Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
        • display.Screen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestScreen

    public class Screen
extends javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
    The Screen class extends the JavaFX Canvas class contains many methods for rendering a Test environment. This class supports:
    • rendering of B2DBody instances
    • a grid (with distance markers if enabled)
    • a marker for a Creature's fitness
    • a camera follow feature
    • drag mouse to adjust framing
    • scroll to zoom
    • information screens to display generation, ID and fitness
    • information screen to display the timer
    NOTE: The refresh method has to be called every frame if the follow feature is enabled.

    • Field Detail

      • gc

        private javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc
        The GraphicsContext gc is used to issue draw calls to a Canvas using a buffer.

      • col_background

        private javafx.scene.paint.Color col_background
        col_background specifies the colour of the background / "sky".

        The default colour is (1, 0.8, 0.8)

      • col_backgroundInactive

        private javafx.scene.paint.Color col_backgroundInactive
        col_background specifies the colour of the background / "sky" when the scene (or the Test) is inactive.

        The default colour is (0.5, 0.5, 0.7)

      • gridEnabled

        private boolean gridEnabled
        gridEnabled can be set to true if a grid should be drawn.

      • camera

        public B2DCamera camera
        camera keeps track of the current camera position and zoom and converts Box2D coordinates to pixel coordinates.

        Default value is true

      • markersEnabled

        private boolean markersEnabled
        markersEnabled can be set to true to label every fifth metre.

        Default value is false

      • infoEnabled

        private int infoEnabled
        infoEnabled specifies whether to show a given information string in the top left corner.

        1 draws normal text
        2 draws smaller text
        0 draws nothing

        Default value is 0

      • infoString

        private java.lang.String infoString
        Holds the string written in the top left corner of the Screen.

      • scrollZoomEnabled

        private boolean scrollZoomEnabled
        If scrollZoomEnabled is true the user can adjust the adjust the framing by dragging and scrolling.

      • viewLock

        private boolean viewLock
        If viewLock is true, the user cannot adjust the framing anymore, zooming is still enabled

      • dragging

        private boolean dragging
        Holds the current state of the mouse being dragged on the Screen

      • dragMousePos

        private org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 dragMousePos
        Holds the position Vec2 of the current mouse position while dragging.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Screen

        public Screen(double xRes,
              double yRes,
              float scale_in,
              org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in)
        Initialises a new Screen object and sets the default Canvas size and the starting values for the framing. EventListerners are initialised for UI-interaction.
        Parameters:
        xRes - amount of horizontal pixels
        yRes - amount of vertical pixels
        scale_in - zoom of the B2DCamera
        pos_in - position of the B2DCamera

    • Method Detail

      • setBackgroundCol

        public void setBackgroundCol(javafx.scene.paint.Color c)
        Sets the primary background colour of the Screen.

        The default colour is (1, 0.8, 0.8)

        Parameters:
        c - sky colour when active

      • setInactiveBackgroundCol

        public void setInactiveBackgroundCol(javafx.scene.paint.Color c)
        Sets the secondary background colour of the Screen when the scene (or the Test) is inactive.

        The default colour is (0.5, 0.5, 0.7)

        Parameters:
        c - sky colour when inactive

      • clearScreen

        public void clearScreen()
        This method clears the whole canvas with the primary background colour and draws the grid, info and/or marker if enabled.

      • clearScreen

        public void clearScreen(boolean active)
        This method clears the whole canvas with the primary background colour or secondary background colour depending on the active boolean and draws the grid, info and/or marker if enabled.
        Parameters:
        active - draw secondary background if false

      • setScreenSize

        public void setScreenSize(int x_in,
                          int y_in)
        Resizes this Screen instance
        Parameters:
        x_in - amount of vertical pixels
        y_in - amount of horizontal pixels

      • drawBody

        public void drawBody(B2DBody body)
        This universal method takes any B2DBody and draws it to the according coordinates on the Screen.

        BodyType, rotation, colour and fill is all considered.

        Parameters:
        body - is drawn on the Screen

      • drawCuboid

        private void drawCuboid(B2DBody cube)
        This method draws a B2DBody with the BodyType CUBOID to the according coordinates on the Screen.

        Rotation, colour and fill is all considered.

        Parameters:
        cube - is drawn on the Screen as a cuboid

      • drawSphere

        private void drawSphere(B2DBody sphere)
        This method draws a B2DBody with the BodyType CIRCLE to the according coordinates on the Screen. A line from the centre to a fixed point on the perimeter is added to represent the angle.

        Rotation, colour and fill is all considered.

        Parameters:
        sphere - is drawn on the Screen as a circle

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 b2d_pos1,
                     org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 b2d_pos2,
                     javafx.scene.paint.Color c)
        This method takes two B2D coordinates as Vec2 vectors and draws a line in the given colour.
        Parameters:
        b2d_pos1 - start point of line
        b2d_pos2 - end point of line
        c - colour of line

      • drawCross

        public void drawCross(B2DBody point)
        This method draws a B2DBody with the BodyType POINT to the according coordinates on the Screen. It is rendered as an "X" with the B2DBody dimensions as length.
        Parameters:
        point - is drawn on the Screen as a cross

      • drawMuscle

        public void drawMuscle(org.jbox2d.dynamics.joints.RevoluteJoint muscle)
        This method draws a line between two B2DBones. The colour varies form white to red, depending on the angle between the Bones.
        Parameters:
        muscle - B2DMuscle to be drawn

      • drawPxLineCircle

        private void drawPxLineCircle(float x,
                              float y,
                              float r,
                              float deg,
                              javafx.scene.paint.Color c,
                              boolean fill)
        This methods takes pixel coordinates and draws a circle with a line form the centre to a fixed point to the perimeter.
        Parameters:
        x - x px-coordinate of the centre
        y - y px-coordinate of the centre
        r - radius in px
        deg - rotation in rad
        c - colour of the circle
        fill - circle is filled when true

      • drawPxCircle

        private void drawPxCircle(float x,
                          float y,
                          float w,
                          float h,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color c,
                          boolean fill)
        This methods takes pixel coordinates and dimensions and draws a circle to the Screen
        Parameters:
        x - x px-coordinate of top left corner
        y - y px-coordinate of bottom left corner
        w - horizontal width in px
        h - vertical height in px
        c - colour of the circle
        fill - circle is filled when true

      • drawPxRect

        private void drawPxRect(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos,
                        org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 dim,
                        float deg,
                        javafx.scene.paint.Color c,
                        boolean fill)
        This methods takes pixel coordinates and draws a circle with a line form the centre to a fixed point to the perimeter.
        Parameters:
        pos - position Vec2 of the centre
        dim - dimension Vec2
        deg - rotation in rad
        c - colour of the circle
        fill - circle is filled when true

      • drawPxRect

        private void drawPxRect(float x,
                        float y,
                        float w,
                        float h,
                        javafx.scene.paint.Color c,
                        boolean fill)
        This methods takes pixel coordinates and dimensions and draws a rectangle to the Screen
        Parameters:
        x - x px-coordinate of top left corner
        y - y px-coordinate of bottom left corner
        w - horizontal width in px
        h - vertical height in px
        c - colour of the rectangle
        fill - rectangle is filled when true

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scale_in)
        Sets the zoom of the B2DCamera. The value given defines how many screen pixels are equivalent to one metre in the Box2D World, so a smaller value zooms out and a bigger value zooms into the scene.
        Parameters:
        scale_in - sets the zoom of this B2DCamera instance

      • getScale

        public float getScale()
        Returns the current zoom value of the B2DCamera. The value represents the number of screen pixels equivalent to one metre in the Box2D World, so if zoomed out, this method returns a small value and the other way around.
        Returns:
        amount of pixels equivalent to one Box2D World metre

      • setPos

        public void setPos(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in)
        Takes Box2D World coordinates as a Vec2 vector and sets the centre of the B2DCamera.
        Parameters:
        pos_in - sets the centre position of this B2DCamera instance

      • addPos

        public void addPos(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in,
                   boolean viewLock)
        Takes Box2D World Vec2 vector and moves the B2DCamera by this vector. It is considering the locked view directions.
        Parameters:
        pos_in - moves the B2DCamera
        viewLock - locks translation directions

      • getPos

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getPos()
        Returns the current position of the B2DCamera. The coordinates are given in Box2D coordinates as a Vec2 vector.
        Returns:
        the location of the B2DCamera

      • enableInfo

        public void enableInfo()
        Calling this method will enable an information string being written in the top left corner of this Screen. The font size in 15.

      • disableInfo

        public void disableInfo()
        Calling this method will disable an information string being written in the top left corner of this Screen.

      • enableCompactInfo

        public void enableCompactInfo()
        Calling this method will enable an information string being written in the top left corner of this Screen. The font size in 12.

      • setInfoString

        public void setInfoString(java.lang.String text)
        This method sets the information string. It is displayed in the top left corner if enabled by enableInfo() oder enableCompactInfo().
        Parameters:
        text - this string is written in the top left

      • infoEnabled

        public int infoEnabled()
        Returns how the information string in the top left corner is displayed:

        1 normal text
        2 smaller text
        0 disabled

        Returns:
        display mode of the information string

      • drawInfo

        private void drawInfo()
        This method draws the information string in the top left corner of this Screen instance.

      • enableGrid

        public void enableGrid()
        Calling this method will show the grid along the x-axis. Every metre is marked and every fifth metre is highlighted. A label can be added by calling enableMarkers().

      • disableGird

        public void disableGird()
        Calling this method will show the grid.

      • gridEnabled

        public boolean gridEnabled()
        Returns true if the grid is enabled.
        Returns:
        gridEnabled boolean

      • drawGrid

        private void drawGrid()
        This method draws the grid to the Screen. Every metre is marked and every fifth metre is highlighted in red.

      • enableMarkers

        public void enableMarkers()
        Calling this method shows a label every five metres with the x-distance from the origin.

      • disableMarkers

        public void disableMarkers()
        Calling this method disables the distance labels.

      • markersEnabled

        public boolean markersEnabled()
        Returns true if the distance labels are enabled.
        Returns:
        markersEnabled boolean

      • drawMarkers

        private void drawMarkers()
        This method draws the distance labels to the Screen.

      • drawScore

        public void drawScore(float fitness)
        This method draws a labelled marker at a given x-coordinate. It is used to mark a Creature's fitness.
        Parameters:
        fitness - x-distance from the origin, fitness

      • drawTimer

        public void drawTimer(float time,
                      float duration)
        This method draws a timer in the top right corner of the Screen. It consists of two values, the time passed time and the entire duration of the timer duration. The times are rounded to one decimal place.

        Layout:
        Time: 1.2s / 10.0s

        Parameters:
        time - elapsed time
        duration - total duration

      • drawTimer

        public void drawTimer(float time,
                      float duration,
                      float speed)
        This method draws a timer with the play-back speed in the top right corner of the Screen. It consists of two values, the time passed time and the entire duration of the timer duration. The times are rounded to one decimal place. The play back speed is added below if is not equal to 1.0

        Layout:
        Time: 1.2s / 10.0s
        2.0x Speed

        Parameters:
        time - elapsed time
        duration - total duration
        speed - current play-back speed

      • scrollEvent

        public void scrollEvent(javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent se)
        This method is called by a ScrollEvent. It handles the zooming-in or zooming-out with the scroll wheel. One raster zooms in by 20% oder out by 25%.

        If the view is locked by enableViewLock(), it takes the target as centre, if not the mouse acts as the centre of magnification.

        Parameters:
        se - ScrollEvent for determining direction and location

      • enableScrollZoom

        public void enableScrollZoom()
        Enables the user to manipulate the framing.

      • disableScrollZoom

        public void disableScrollZoom()
        Calling this method disables framing by the user.

      • dragCameraStarted

        public void dragCameraStarted(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent me)
        This method is called by a MouseEvent when starting a mouse drag. It initialises the drag move.
        Parameters:
        me - MouseEvent for location

      • dragCamera

        public void dragCamera(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent me)
        This method is called by a MouseEvent pressed-dragging the mouse. The camera follows the movement of the mouse during the this period.
        Parameters:
        me - MouseEvent for location

      • dragCameraEnded

        public void dragCameraEnded(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent me)
        This method is called by a MouseEvent when ending a mouse drag. It terminates the drag move.
        Parameters:
        me - MouseEvent

      • refreshFollow

        public void refreshFollow(float dt,
                          float playBackSpeed,
                          org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2D_target,
                          org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2D_offset,
                          boolean running)
        Camera follow feature

        This method has to be called very frame with a Box2D-World coordinate the B2DCamera instance has to follow. Use offset Vec2 to adjust the framing. The time since the last frame dt is used to calculate the acceleration and speed of B2DCamera. To adjust for the faster movement when fast-forwarding, pass the current playBackSpeed to this method. If running is false, the B2DCamera wont follow.

        Parameters:
        dt - delta time
        playBackSpeed - current play-back speed
        B2D_target - target coordinate the B2DCamera should follow
        B2D_offset - offset from target
        running - TestScreen is running

      • toggleViewLock

        public void toggleViewLock()
        Camera follow feature

        Toggles the directional lock. If true the B2DCamera will follow a given target coordinate and doesn't listen to the user's input.

      • enableViewLock

        public void enableViewLock()
        Camera follow feature

        Enables the directional lock. The B2DCamera will follow a given target coordinate and doesn't listen to the user's input.

      • toggleViewLock

        public void toggleViewLock(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2D_target,
                           boolean running)
        Camera follow feature

        Toggles the directional lock and specifies the target. If running is true the B2DCamera will follow the given target coordinate and doesn't listen to the user's input.

        Parameters:
        B2D_target - references the target coordinate
        running - TestScreen is running

      • isViewLocked

        public boolean isViewLocked()
        Camera follow feature

        Returns true if the camera follow feature is currently enabled.

        Returns:
        true when the B2DCamera is locked to a target

      • resetView

        public void resetView()
        Camera follow feature

        Resets the position and zoom of the B2DCamera to the values it had been initialised with.
